definition: (once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
"dot" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 3)/see also 點|点[dian3]
to put one's hands on one's hips/also written 插腰[cha1 yao1]
the splits (move in dancing)/to do the splits/Taiwan pr. [pi3 cha1]
three-dimensional road junction (i.e. involving flyover bridges or underpass tunnels)/overpass

sentences.english: Lester ruminated for a while, toying with his fork.
sentences.chinese: 雷斯脱手里拿一把叉玩弄着沉吟了半晌。

sentences.english: in the cork workshop, the workers fork the pork.
sentences.chinese: 在栓皮厂房，工许多人用叉子叉猪肉。

sentences.english: Place tablespoonfuls of mixture onto a baking paper lined tray. Flatten slightly with a floured fork.
sentences.chinese: 汤勺将混合勺满烤纸，叉将其稍微压扁。

sentences.english: Don't forget the salad forks and the placemats.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了沙拉叉和餐具垫喔。

sentences.english: A medium-sized, all-dark storm petrel with a.
sentences.chinese: 为一中型，具有叉尾中等的黑色海燕。

sentences.english: Secondly, the process for producing liquid smoking Channel Catfish block was studied.
sentences.chinese: 其次对液熏斑点叉尾鲴加工工艺进行研究。

sentences.english: This company manufacturers and sells plastic wishbones .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司制造和销售塑料叉。

sentences.english: A ball rests in the fork of a branch of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 一个球停在了一棵树的枝叉上。

sentences.english: It may be bar tacking on top of slit if buyer's comment requested.
sentences.chinese: 如果客户评语要求的话，要在叉顶打枣。

sentences.english: Variable speed lathe with a fork is the product of one of the main parts.
sentences.chinese: 车床变速用拨叉是某企业产品的主要零件之一。

sentences.english: We gigged for catfish off the pier.
sentences.chinese: 我们在码头以鱼叉叉鲶鱼。

sentences.english: A cutlery set includes knives, forks, spoons etc.
sentences.chinese: 一套餐具包括刀，叉，匙等。

sentences.english: Illustration of Raudraksa's battle with Sariputra is one of the main themes in Dunhuang arts.
sentences.chinese: 《劳度叉斗圣变》是敦煌艺术中的主要题材之一。

sentences.english: He tried to hoick the meat out of the tin with a fork .
sentences.chinese: 他试著幽虫子毖罐头里的肉使劲叉出来。

sentences.english: The townsmen grabbed their guns and their pitchforks and ran toward the witch.
sentences.chinese: 市民劫掠了他们的枪和他们的干草叉并且跑了往巫婆。

sentences.english: We separated the salad forks from the dinner forks.
sentences.chinese: 我们把沙拉叉与餐叉分隔开。

definition: to put one's hands on one's hips
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
pitchfork/garden fork/restraining pole (used by police)/military fork (of ancient times)
to put one's hands on one's hips/also written 插腰[cha1 yao1]
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
classifier for hair or grass: tuft/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
to pick up (a powder etc) with the fingertips/to scoop up/to collect together/to extract/to gather up/classifier: pinch/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
to protrude/to stick out/to pout (also written 噘)/to embarrass (people)
